Key Match Events: Golden State Warriors built an 11-point lead in the first two minutes of the second quarter
Memphis Grizzlies slowly chipped away the lead and even took it with three minutes left at the half
Golden State Warriors pulled away with five minutes left in the third quarter
Warriors kept the visitors at bay led by Lindy Waters III and Andrew Wiggins, who both hit clutch shots to ice the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Memphis Grizzlies and Golden State Warriors battled it out again on Saturday night for the third time this season
Both teams are without their best players in Ja Morant and Steph Curry, respectively, due to injuries
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State won their first back-to-back since Nov. 22, which showed how much they needed the win
Memphis, on the other hand, has now lost two in a row and dropped to third in the Western Conference standings
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grizzlies began the fourth quarter by being within a point twice in the first five minutes
Andrew Wiggins stepped up for Golden State, finishing with 24 points, three assists and four steals to lead the Warriors to a 121-113 win
Dennis Schroder had 17 points and nine assists, while Lindy Waters III provided 16 points off the bench
Others: Jaren Jackson Jr. contributed 23 points and nine rebounds for the Grizzlies
Desmond Bane had 22 points, 10 assists and two steals for the Grizzlies, but also had eight turnovers
Jonathan Kuminga had 13 points off the bench for the Warriors
